Radio Silence

# BITSY VERSION 3.2

DLG 10
Mmm, cozy couch. 

DLG 12
You jump on the windowsill to look in.  Ugh.  They have a dog. 

DLG 13
Ugghhhh.  Dogs pee on everything. 

DLG 14
The snowman is made of dry, fluffy snow.  It's a little crumbly. 

DLG 15
The snowman is made of dry, fluffy snow.  It's a little crumbly. 

DLG 16
The snowman is made of dry, fluffy snow.  It's a little crumbly. 

DLG 17
The apartment building is quiet; it's Christmas Eve, after all. 

DLG 18
The tea shop is closed, but you can see an arrangement of christmas-y tea cups in the window. There's mice in there, too!  You flick your tail in frustration. 

DLG a
I'm a cat

DLG b
Simpkin, what will I do? I need a vacuum tube to finish this radio for my niece Freda.  Otherwise it won't work!  But my old legs... and it's so cold outside...

DLG c

DLG e
Out of the window, snow is falling.

DLG g
There is another house over there.  You wonder if they have any cat food. 

DLG h

DLG i
Shoveling all that snow is going to take a lot of work.

The old man's work table is really cluttered. There's a little red radio in the middle of the clutter.

DLG n
The little red radio is silent. 

DLG l
It's so warm by the fire.  Nap time?

DLG s
Your food bowl is empty.  Dinner is such a long time away!

DLG t
The old man's bed is neatly made. 

DLG u
The old man's bed is neatly made. 

DLG w
A ball of yarn!  It's exciting, but the old man is too distracted to play. 

DLG x
Mmm, cozy couch. 

DLG 1a
If you press your ears against the door, you can hear the hum of sleeping machinery in the factory. 

DLG 1b


DLG 1c
Simpkin!  You found a vacuum tube!  All these years I thought you were useless, sleeping by the fire!  I can fix the radio for my niece!

DLG 1d
Simpkin!  You found a vacuum tube!  All these years I thought you were useless, sleeping by the fire!  I can fix the radio for my niece!

DLG 1e

DLG 1i
Vacuum cleaner!  Your worst enemy!  You give it a wide berth. 

DLG 1j

DLG 1l
The TV is playing It's A Wonderful Life. Even as a cat you can tell James Stewart is a stud. 

DLG 1k
It's tempting to sit in the chair and watch James Stewart discover how loved he is...

DLG 1n
The table is covered in junk. Mostly buttons. But--wait--it's a vacuum tube!! You glance at the shop owner, but she's vacuuming and trying to catch a glimpse of James Stewart. She probably won't miss a greasy old vacuum tube.  

DLG 1o
The sign on the desk says Ms. Potter's Antiques and Treasured Junk. Bartering encouraged. 

DLG 1p
The old radio is silent.  You wonder if it needs a vacuum tube. 

DLG 1q

DLG 1r

DLG 1s

DLG 1u

DLG 1t

DLG 1w
Your food bowl is full!  Yum, kibble! 

DLG 1x

END 0


END undefined
Ahhh...nap time at last.
